item.title: Configure JWT Authentication with Grafana
item.description: JSON Web Tokens (JWTs) offer seamless sign-in, allowing users to carry their authentication securely across different applications within the same ecosystem. In this article, let’s go through the process of configuring JWT-based authentication with Grafana for a smoother user experience. Create a RSA key pair Begin by creating an RSA key pair. The private key will sign the JWT token, while the public key will verify it. ssh-keygen -t rsa -b 4096 -m PEM -f grafana.
